revised_title: Awards and Achievements in Science: Royal Society Anniversary Address 1983
tldr: In this address, Sir Andrew Huxley highlights the accomplishments and contributions of various scientists in fields such as immunology, genetics, chemistry, and physics. He also discusses the ongoing debate on animal experimentation and the role of the President in regulating it. The Royal Society awards medals to distinguished researchers for their groundbreaking work in various scientific disciplines.
